revision.comment: Correct as of match played 22/2/19, vs Assyriska IK
revision.text:
{{Infobox football biography | name = Sead Hakšabanović | image = | fullname = Sead Hakšabanović{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1999|05|04|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Hyltebruk]], Sweden{{cite web|title=West Ham sign Montenegro international Sead Haksabanovic|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/august/07-august/west-ham-sign-montenegro-international-sead-haksabanovic|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=7 August 2017|accessdate=8 August 2017}} | height = 1.74 m | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[IFK Norrköping|IFK Norrköping]]
(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = 2006–2015 | youthclubs1 = [[Halmstads BK]] | years1 = 2015–2017 | clubs1 = [[Halmstads BK]] | caps1 = 58 | goals1 = 12 | years2 = 2017– | clubs2 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018 | clubs3 = → [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] (loan) | caps3 = 2 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2019– | clubs4 = → [[IFK Norrköping|IFK Norrköping]] (loan) | caps4 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Sweden national under-17 football team|Sweden U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 19 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[Sweden national under-19 football team|Sweden U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 13:26, 17 January 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 17 January 2019 }} '''Sead Hakšabanović''' ({{lang-sr-Cyrl|Сеад Хакшабановић}}, {{IPA-sr|seːad hakʃabaːnoʋitɕ|}}; born 4 May 1999) is a Swedish-born Montenegrin [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] for Swedish club [[IFK Norrköping]], on loan from English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], and for the [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro national team]]. He has previously played for [[Halmstads BK]]. ==Club career== ===Halmstad=== Hakšabanović represented [[Halmstads BK]] as a youth. He made his debut in [[Allsvenskan]] on 9 April 2015, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Junes Barny]] in a 0–3 home loss against [[IFK Norrköping]]; at the age of only 15, he became the youngest-ever footballer to debut for Halmstad and the second youngest to debut in Allsvenskan after [[Nicklas Bärkroth]].{{cite web|url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/fotboll/sverige/allsvenskan/article20602349.ab |title=Här går 15-åringens dröm i uppfyllelse... |publisher=aftonbladet.se |language=Swedish|date=9 April 2015 |accessdate=9 November 2016}} In August 2015 Hakšabanović spent a week on trial with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].{{cite web|url=http://www.expressen.se/kvallsposten/sport/man-united-stjarnans-rad-till-hbk-talangen/|title=Man United-stjärnans råd till HBK-talangen |publisher=expressen.se |language=Swedish|date=15 November 2016 |accessdate=26 August 2015}} He has also been on trials for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fotbolldirekt.se/talangbloggen/2016/04/02/jan-jonsson-om-superettantalangen-valdigt-mycket-locktoner-fran-utlandet/|title=Jan Jönsson om super(ettan)talangen: "Väldigt mycket locktoner från utlandet" |publisher=fotbolldirekt.se |language=Swedish|date=15 November 2016 |accessdate=2 April 2016}} After spending his first senior season with only ten appearances and no goals, Hakšabanović scored his first goal on 4 April 2016, netting his team's only in a 2–1 away loss against [[IK Sirius Fotboll]]. ===West Ham United=== In August 2017, Hakšabanović signed a five-year contract, for a fee reported to be £2.7 million, for [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40856837|title=Sead Haksabanovic: West Ham sign teenager from Halmstads BK|date=7 August 2017|publisher=|accessdate=9 August 2017|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} He made his debut for West Ham on 19 September, playing 63 minutes in a 3–0 home victory against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] in the [[2017–18 EFL Cup|EFL Cup]]. ====Málaga (loan)==== On 6 August 2018, Hakšabanović joined Spanish [[Segunda División]] side [[Málaga CF]] on loan for one season.{{Cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/august/06-august/sead-haksabanovic-joins-malaga-season-long-loan|title=Sead Haksabanovic joins Malaga on season-long loan {{!}} West Ham United|website=www.whufc.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-06}} On 17 November 2018, he made his debut in a 2-0 win against [[Gimnàstic de Tarragona]].{{cite web|url=http://www.vijesti.me/sport/povratak-haksabanovica-debitovao-za-malagu-ostavio-dobar-utisak-1013090|author=Danilo Mitrović|work=[[Vijesti]]|title=''Povratak Hakšabanovića: Debitovao za Malagu, ostavio dobar utisak''|language=Serbian|date=November 19, 2018}} ====IFK Norrköping==== In January 2019, he joined [[IFK Norrköping]] on loan until the end of the 2019–20 season.{{Cite web |title=Sead Haksabanovic klar för IFK Norrköping |trans-title=Sead Hakšabanović ready for IFK Norrkoping |publisher=IFK Norrköping |date=17 January 2019 |accessdate=17 January 2019 |url= http://ifknorrkoping.se/nyheter/arkiv/sead-haksabanovic-klar-foer-ifk-norrkoeping |language=Swedish}} ==International career== Hakšabanović made his international senior debut for [[Montenegro national football team]] in a 4–1 [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] victory over [[Armenia national football team|Armenia]], on 10 June 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276483/match=300332039/index.html|title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches — Montenegro-Armenia — FIFA.com|first=|last=FIFA.com|website=FIFA.com|accessdate=8 August 2017}} ==Personal life== His entire family is from [[Montenegro]].{{cite web|url=http://cg-fudbal.com/haksabanovic-moja-porodica-je-iz-crne-gore-osjecam-ljubav-prema-crnoj-gori/ |title=Hakšabanović: Moja porodica je iz Crne Gore, osjećam ljubav prema Crnoj Gori |publisher=cg-fudbal.com |language=bs |date=25 May 2017 |accessdate=25 May 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 22 February 2019}} {{Soccerway|sead-haksabanovic/393143|accessdate=13 August 2017}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League
